adjective module

class src.explainer.adjective.Adjective(name: str, adjective_type: AdjectiveType, explanation: Explanation, tactics: List[Tactic], *, definition: str, skip_statement=False)[source]

Bases: ABC

Abstract base class for all types of adjectives.

add_explanation_tactic(tactic)[source]
add_explanation_tactics(tactics)[source]
contextualize(framework: ArgumentationFramework)[source]

Sets the Argumentation framework the Adjective belongs to.

decontextualize()[source]

Undo the contextualization.

evaluate(*args, explanation_tactics=None) → Any[source]

Evaluate the adjective. If args are passed, evaluate in context. If not, this is just an implication inside abstract knowledge.

Parameters:

*args – Variable length argument list.

Returns:

The value of the adjective for the given node.

explain(node: Any, other_nodes: Any = None, *, explanation_tactics=None, current_explanation_depth, explain_further=True) → Implies[source]

Provide an explanation for the adjective’s value on a given node.

Parameters:

  • node – The node to explain the adjective for.

  • other_node – The optional other node for Comparison Adjectives

Returns:

An Implies object representing the explanation.

explanations_book = None
get_explanation_tactic(tactic_name)[source]
init_explanations_book()[source]
list_explanation_tactics()[source]
proposition(*args, explanation_tactics=None) → Proposition[source]

Create a Proposition object representing this adjective.

Parameters:

  • *args – Variable length argument list.

  • **kwargs – Arbitrary keyword arguments.

Returns:

A Proposition object representing this adjective.

When defining the proposition, consider that it has to take as input the return of the evaluate() method to produce a consequent proposition in the explain() method.

refer_to_nodes_as = None
set_getter(getter: str)[source]

Contextualizes the adjective onto the current tree by specifying the getter function that permits to evaluate the adjective.

class src.explainer.adjective.AuxiliaryAdjective(name, getter)[source]

Bases: PointerAdjective

Auxiliary Adjectives are created dynamically during explanations. They have as getter a queue system.

add_getter(new_getter)[source]
class src.explainer.adjective.BooleanAdjective(name: str, definition: str = 'node.no_getter_provided', explanation: Explanation = None, tactics=None)[source]

Bases: Adjective

Represents a boolean adjective.

class src.explainer.adjective.ComparisonAdjective(name: str, property_pointer_adjective_name: str, operator: str, *, explanation=None, tactics=None)[source]

Bases: Adjective

Represents a ranking adjective used for comparing nodes. Comparison nodes do not need a getter to be evaluated.

While explaining a Comparison Adjective you can refer to an auxiliary adjective called “compared to”.

class src.explainer.adjective.MaxRankAdjective(name: str, comparison_adjective_name: ComparisonAdjective, nodes_group_pointer_adjective_name: PointerAdjective, tactics=None)[source]

Bases: _RankAdjective

class src.explainer.adjective.MinRankAdjective(name: str, comparison_adjective_name: ComparisonAdjective, nodes_group_pointer_adjective_name: PointerAdjective, tactics=None)[source]

Bases: _RankAdjective

class src.explainer.adjective.NodesGroupPointerAdjective(name: str, definition: str = 'node.no_getter_provided', explanation: Explanation = None, tactics=None, *, excluding: str)[source]

Bases: PointerAdjective

Represents a pointer adjective that references a group of objects. You can specify an object to not include from the group definition through the “excluding” parameter. .. rubric:: Example

NodesGroupPointerAdjective(“siblings”, definition = “node.parent.children”, excluding = “node”)

class src.explainer.adjective.PointerAdjective(name: str, definition: str = 'node.no_getter_provided', explanation: Explanation = None, tactics=None, *, _custom_getter=None, skip_statement=False)[source]

Bases: Adjective

Represents a pointer adjective that references a specific attribute or object.

class src.explainer.adjective.QuantitativePointerAdjective(name: str, definition: str = 'node.no_getter_provided', explanation: Explanation = None, tactics=None, *, _custom_getter=None, skip_statement=False)[source]

Bases: PointerAdjective

class src.explainer.adjective.NodesGroupPointerAdjective(name: str, definition: str = 'node.no_getter_provided', explanation: Explanation = None, tactics=None, *, excluding: str)[source]

Bases: PointerAdjective

Represents a pointer adjective that references a group of objects. You can specify an object to not include from the group definition through the “excluding” parameter. .. rubric:: Example

NodesGroupPointerAdjective(“siblings”, definition = “node.parent.children”, excluding = “node”)

class src.explainer.adjective.ComparisonAdjective(name: str, property_pointer_adjective_name: str, operator: str, *, explanation=None, tactics=None)[source]

Bases: Adjective

Represents a ranking adjective used for comparing nodes. Comparison nodes do not need a getter to be evaluated.

While explaining a Comparison Adjective you can refer to an auxiliary adjective called “compared to”.

class src.explainer.adjective._RankAdjective(name: str, comparison_adjective_name: str, group_pointer_adjective_name: str, explanation: Explanation, tactics: List[Tactic], evaluator: Callable[[Any, ComparisonAdjective, PointerAdjective], bool])[source]

Bases: BooleanAdjective

Represents a static (boolean) adjective that specifically refers to the property of being x ranked in a group, based on a given comparison adjective and the evaluator function. This is parent class of MaxRankAdjective and MinRankAdjective.

class src.explainer.adjective.MaxRankAdjective(name: str, comparison_adjective_name: ComparisonAdjective, nodes_group_pointer_adjective_name: PointerAdjective, tactics=None)[source]

Bases: _RankAdjective

Bases: _RankAdjective
